section.section: Each appointed member of the council shall serve for a term of two (2) years or until a successor is appointed and may be reappointed for additional terms.

The chair or a majority of the members may call a meeting to order, and the council may meet as often as necessary for the conduct of its business. A majority of the membership shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business.

The council shall:
Advise the department concerning the implementation and administration of the Kentucky Proud™ Program; and
Make recommendations to the department regarding the content of administrative regulations promulgated by the department in accordance with KRS 260.016 to 260.019.

text.section: Appointed council members may be reimbursed for reasonable and necessary expenses incurred while engaged in carrying out the official duties of the council.
The council shall be attached to the Department of Agriculture for administrative purposes.

law.history: Created 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 154, sec. 5, effective July 15, 2008.
